Can you elaborate on what this usecase is? Please add more information on the JIRA explaining the problem, and the intended solution. 

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-1581
Also, there has been some updates to the flume stream code, it may be a good idea to merge from the master.

I think there are multiple parallel attempts to upgrade flume to 1.4.0. Please take a look at the discussion in this thread. Its better to consolidate the efforts.

https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/507
Yeah, Ted and I failed to coordinate.  Closing this one.

Yeah, it looks like even if we set `SPARK_YARN_APP_NAME` it will never get propagated to the YARN client. I agree that switching around the two conditions will correct this, but how will the other configs be affected?

More generally, what semantics should we provide here? Should env vars always take precedence over the corresponding value in `spark.*` configuration options? @pwendell

Jenkins, retest this.

Personal opinion: the less cluster-specific options we have the better, so unless there's a very compelling reason to keep SPARK_YARN_APP_NAME supported, I'd just remove it and use the configured app name always. It seems to me, from the code, that it was just a workaround for the real bug anyway (the app name not being read from the config, but from the JVM system properties).

LGTM, the semantics and performance of this seem quite reasonable. The synchronzied block should be virtually cost-less in normal operation, and I trust java.concurrent's implementation of Semaphore.

I have merged this! Thanks @jerryshao 

BTW, note that there are new additions to the StreamingListener interface that allows you to get the receiver state (running or not, where it is running, etc.). You may want to add those to the metrics source as well. This is merged, so you can create a new PR if you want.
I have merged the other PR. Can you close this one please. :)
